title: Launch an instance with OpenStack Networking (neutron) in OpenStack Installation Guide for Red Hat Enterprise Linux, CentOS, and Fedora  - icehouse  Failed to close augeas aug_close: do_aug_close: you must call 'aug-init' first to initialize Augeas

comments.content:
centos6.5+icehouse  
when ：
 Launch an instance with OpenStack Networking (neutron)     error


2014-06-10 13:14:58.354 2786 INFO oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_qpid [-] Connected to AMQP server on controller:5672
2014-06-10 13:23:39.074 2786 WARNING nova.virt.disk.vfs.guestfs [req-29f113b4-6f3a-4c59-a2dc-70c4bd0514af f9ebab09cbe1446fb07229f9ba53edad 7fa0b1e3152c4082a876f6dcd28d5e15] Failed to close augeas aug_close: do_aug_close: you must call 'aug-init' first to initialize Augeas
2014-06-10 13:23:40.555 2786 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [req-29f113b4-6f3a-4c59-a2dc-70c4bd0514af f9ebab09cbe1446fb07229f9ba53edad 7fa0b1e3152c4082a876f6dcd28d5e15] An error occurred while trying to launch a defined domain with xml: <domain type='kvm'>
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zhanghaidi326

comments.content: In my environments, the Augeas warning does not prevent launching of VMs. Do you see any other errors relating to libvirt and/or KVM? Additional logging might require configuring verbose logging in nova-compute.conf.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ionosphere80

comments.content: [Expired for openstack-manuals because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor

comments.content:
Adding log with TRACE

augeas-libs.x86_64                    1.1.0-12.el7               @rhel7-released
openstack-nova-api.noarch             2014.1.2-1.el7ost          @puddle        
openstack-nova-common.noarch          2014.1.2-1.el7ost          @puddle        
openstack-nova-compute.noarch         2014.1.2-1.el7ost          @puddle        
python-nova.noarch                    2014.1.2-1.el7ost          @puddle
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jhenner

comments.content:
It looks to me that this is fixed in new augeas:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=894241
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jhenner

comments.content: jhenner, which version of libguestfs do you have?  That BZ was a pre-RHEL 7.0 issue which was fixed before GA, so I wouldn't think it's possible to hit it, unless you're using a combination of RHEL 7.0 beta and GA packages or something.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~domcleal

comments.content: Looks like an upstream issue with auges
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Thank you for helping me.
Because time is too long, openstack clusters have been deleted and reinstalled. The details of the comparison was blurred.

Later I use ubuntu12 server + icehouse + kvm. There have been no problems.

Later I use ubuntu12 server + icehouse + kvm. There have been no problems.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zhanghaidi326

comments.content:
Dominik, sorry, I was again confusing libguestfs and augeas. Fool me. The reproduce was with 

libguestfs-1.22.6-22.el7.x86_64

With some more investigation, I am smelling it may or may be related with too low RAM and tmpfs. I have seen some test failing  with "No space left on device" when doing some libguestfs
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jhenner

comments.content:
Just note that this is also discussed on RHBZ, as it is not known whether it is RHOS related problem or problem in nova.

 https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1328872
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jhenner

comments.content: This looks like a problem of too low of RAM on the nova-compute host and throwing the real error somewhere to /dev/null.  Check the RHBZ for more info.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jhenner
